records.location_text_raw: Text Removed - Operational Area Bulgaria, Plovdiv
records.context_note: A Human Resources staff member deployed to Bulgaria experienced health issues with an eye, including pain and redness due to high pressure. She received sick leave and was hospitalized in Plovdiv for further medical checks to release eye pressure. Her shifts were cancelled. She was later released from the hospital, recovered, and scheduled for a medical check-up.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Human Resources with health issues on eye... On 08.04.2021 she went to a special eye doctor in Plovdiv... She has too much pressure in the eye which cause pain and the eye is turning red.

records.location_text_raw: Text Removed - Operational Area, Text Removed - Operational Area Bulgaria
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Bulgaria is not provided, only 'Operational Area'.
records.context_note: Two Human Resources staff members deployed to an Operational Area in Bulgaria tested positive for COVID-19 on 26.03.2021 after experiencing sickness. They were instructed to self-isolate and undergo testing. A second team who had contact with them also self-isolated and was tested. Both individuals eventually tested negative after 14 days of quarantine and returned to service.
records.evidence_quote: Posistive COVID test for 2 Text Removed - Human Resources... On 26.03.2021 the information provided by Text Removed - Human Resources confirmed their positive COVID test results.

records.context_note: A Human Resources staff member deployed to an Operational Area in Bulgaria tested positive for COVID-19 on 23.03.2021. Due to mandatory quarantine, the individual had to stay 14 days longer in Bulgaria. Health condition worsened, leading to hospitalization in an Operational Area on 30.03.2021, and later evacuation to Germany on 01.04.2021. The individual recovered and was released from hospital in Germany on 15.04.2021.
records.evidence_quote: Text removed - Human Resources COVID 19 positive... tested positive on COVID 19 on 23.03.2021... hospitalized this morning, 30.03.2021, in Text Removed - Operational Area... evacuated their Text Removed - Human Resources on 1 April 2021 from Bulgaria to Germany.

records.location_text_raw: Text Removed - Operational Area, Sofia, Bulgaria
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Sofia is not provided, only 'Operational Area'.
records.context_note: One Human Resources staff member deployed to an Operational Area in Sofia, Bulgaria, tested positive for COVID-19 on 24.03.2021. Four direct contacts were identified and instructed to perform COVID tests and self-isolate in their accommodation until results were received. The positive individual was under mandatory quarantine for 14 days. All contacts later tested negative and resumed work.
records.evidence_quote: One Text Removed - Human Resources positive to COVID-19... On 24.03.2021, 1 Text Removed - Human Resources deployed in Text Removed - Operational Area... received the results that he was found 'POSITIVE' to the virus.

records.location_text_raw: Text Removed - Operational Area Sofia, Bulgaria
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Sofia is not provided, only 'Operational Area'.
records.context_note: Two Human Resources staff members deployed to an Operational Area in Sofia, Bulgaria, reported COVID-19 symptoms and tested positive on 23.03.2021. They were placed under 14-day quarantine. No direct contacts were found. Technical equipment was closed and parked for disinfection.
records.evidence_quote: Initial SIR - Two Text Removed - Human Resources positive to COVID-19... On 23.03.2021 Text Removed - Human Resources... both of them were tested POSITIVE.

records.location_text_raw: Text Removed - Operational Area Sofia, Bulgaria
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Sofia is not provided, only 'Operational Area'.
records.context_note: A Human Resources staff member deployed to an Operational Area in Sofia, Bulgaria, tested positive for COVID-19 on 11.03.2021. This individual had been in close contact and shared a car with another Human Resources staff member on 08.03.2021 and 10.03.2021. Both individuals were instructed to self-isolate and perform PCR tests. They later tested negative and resumed their shifts.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Human Resources in close contact with a COVID 19 positive person... Today, 11.03.2021 around Text Removed - Reporting Tools the mentioned Text Removed - Human Resources called the Text Removed - Human Resources with information, that he has been tested positive for COVID-19.

records.location_text_raw: Text Removed - Operational Area Sofia, Bulgaria
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Sofia is not provided, only 'Operational Area'.
records.context_note: One Human Resources staff member deployed to an Operational Area in Sofia, Bulgaria, tested positive for COVID-19 on 08.02.2021 after experiencing sickness since 03.02.2021. The individual was immediately put in self-isolation. Another Human Resources staff member who had direct contact was also put in self-isolation as a precautionary measure. Both underwent quarantine and later returned to duties without clinical symptoms.
records.evidence_quote: One Text Removed - Human Resources tested positive for COVID-19... On 06.02.2021, one Text Removed - Human Resources... performed a COVID-19 test... he has been found POSITIVE against COVID-19.

records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Bulgaria is not provided.
records.context_note: A TM (Team Member) deployed to Bulgaria tested positive for COVID-19 on 26.04.2021. The TM was placed in 14-day isolation in accommodation and received support. Close contacts were identified, and one TM underwent an antigen test, while two other TMs underwent PCR tests as a precautionary measure. The TM ended quarantine on 08.05.2021 and resumed regular shifts.
records.evidence_quote: TM deployed to JO FP Land tested COVID positive... The test result on 26.04.2021 is positive.

records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Bulgaria is not provided, only 'Operational area'.
records.context_note: A package containing technical equipment intended for Bulgaria was delivered to the wrong address in Bulgaria by TNT due to a mix-up in the postal code. The recipient immediately informed local police and visited the incorrect address, but the residents denied receiving any delivery. Efforts to track the shipment with TNT were ongoing, including visiting the TNT warehouse (which was closed on weekends). The equipment is described as double-use (civilian and military) and of considerable value.
records.evidence_quote: Possible loss of FX TE Type of technical equipment... TNT delivered one package of [Text Removed] which was intended for [Text Removed] Bulgaria. Apparently the shipment was delivered to wrong address due to the mix up in the zip postal code.
